projects.name: FitFromHome
projects.summary: A platform that allows users to schedule virtual fitness sessions.
projects.description: With COVID-19 lockdowns taking place across the province, myself and three of my classmates had the idea to build an app that allows people to participate in virtual fitness classes. FitFromHome was built at HackWestern 7 and it allows users to browse and choose from a wide variety of workouts for all skill levels, hosted by experienced trainers. Users are able to browse the catalog of scheduled workout classes, pick and choose classes they want to attend, and then register and attend the live video class. The fitness classes are run via web cam in the browser with the use of Socket.io to set up live video calling. Fitness instructors are also able to run individual as well as group sessions on the app.

pictures.caption: Explore page with training sessions available to be booked

projects.name: PairBnB
projects.summary: A cross-platform mobile app allowing couples to book stays at houses.
projects.description: To learn making cross-platform mobile apps with Ionic, I created PairBnB which is an app for couples to book houses posted by owners for their vacations - much like AirBnB. I implemented native device features such as using the device's camera and geolocation to make it easier for hosts to create their house offerings. I also implemented other mobile platform development features and standards such as modals and hamburger menus to improve the user experience when navigating through the app.

pictures.caption: Property view, can browse property features and book.

projects.name: Java Sketchpad
projects.summary: A Microsoft paint like app where users are able to draw pictures.
projects.description: Using Java I developed a sketchpad application where users can create drawings of their choice by selecting from the various shape and color options available. The application also has a save feature for the user to save the image that they created.

projects.name: Captivate Youth
projects.summary: Responsive full-stack website made for the Captivate Youth Foundation.
projects.description: Working as a freelance web developer, I made the responsive full-stack website of the Captivate Youth Foundation. It is a blog-style website with admin functionality for the executives of the foundation to add, update, and delete posts. AWS S3 and Elastic Beanstalk were used to deploy and host the website.

projects.name: Personal Portfolio Website
projects.description: Going into my final year of university I decided to make a personal portfolio website prior to finding a new graduate job opportunity. This website allows me to go into further detail about myself and my projects than I could on a one page resume. Developing this website also helped improve my Angular and front-end design skills, especially in making and designing responsive web applications.

projects.name: Mediator Design Pattern
projects.summary: A form that facilitates employee profile data entry process.
projects.description: To gain more exposure to software design patterns I developed a simple form that facilitates employee profile data entry process using the mediator design pattern.

pictures.caption: Interface for adding a new employee.
Selecting employee profile auto-fills the form fields.

projects.name: Observer Design Pattern
projects.summary: A form that outputs results of mathematical operations using the Observer pattern.
projects.description: This project was done to practice my knowledge of the Observer Design Pattern. The user simply inputs two numbers and the results of the addition, multiplication, and division of the two numbers is outputted.

projects.name: Sorting Algorithm Visualizer
projects.summary: A web app to help visualize the different ways of sorting.
projects.description: To help further my understanding of sorting algorithms as well as Angular, I decided to develop this web app that breaks down the common sorting algorithms step-by-step. The user can select the size of the array they want to sort, the type of sort, then watch the visualization of the sorting algorithm.

projects.name: MyMusic
projects.summary: A full-stack web app similar to IMDb for rating and reviewing songs.
projects.description: To gain experience using the MEAN software stack I developed this full-stack web app. Users are able to add songs to rate and review. There is added functionality for users who register such as being able to add a song to rate as well as add reviews to songs added by other users. Website also has admin functionality for monitoring posts.

pictures.caption: Form for adding a new song.

projects.name: Remote Image Display
projects.description: Based on a client-server architecture, the server provides an image to the client to download and display directly using the clients default image viewer.

pictures.caption: Client and Server running on the command line, and image being displayed.

projects.name: A Peer Node
projects.description: A peer to peer program in which a peer that receives a join request will accept the peer if and only if its peer table is not full. If the peer's table is full then the requesting peer gets redirected to the nearest peer.

pictures.caption: Peer 4 rejected from Peer 1 because of full peer table, redirected to Peer 2.

work.title: Freelance Web Developer
work.summary: I helped develop the full-stack web application for the captivate youth organization founded by Western University students. I worked closely with the founders of the organization to ensure that the website fit their needs and met their expectations.
keyPoints: Worked through the entire software development lifecycle to design and ship a website that had to meet client requirements
Progressed my development skills in Angular and Node.js

work.title: Financial Services Representative
work.summary: As a bank teller at CUA I was the front-line service representative for members and local businesses coming into the branch to perform various financial transactions. This role helped me further my financial knowledge, answering various questions regarding members personal finances. Furthermore, I developed many connections with local business owners and members through helping them with their finances.
keyPoints: Accelerated branch revenue growth by 2% by recruiting new members
Prepared and processed large money orders (up to $400,000)

work.title: Data Entry Representative
work.summary: Working alongside 50-70 employees at any given time, I kept record of real-time sports data at Gracenote for all major sports leagues. In this position, I used my sports knowledge to help me efficiently keep track of multiple sports games at the same time. This data was published in real-time to Gracenote's sports website where gambling odds were generated.
keyPoints: Recorded real-time sports statistics into company database
Analyzed other employees work before data was published to clients to ensure 100% accuracy
